title: 5-Minute Deep Breathing
description: Practice box breathing to reduce stress and improve focus during study sessions.

study_break_integration.purpose: Mental reset for continued learning focus
study_break_integration.effectiveness: Improves concentration for next study session by 35%

individual_personalization.for_stressed_students: Especially beneficial when tackling difficult subjects
individual_personalization.for_achievement_focused: Track breathing consistency as measurable wellness goal

ai_assistant_messaging: Time for a mental reset! This breathing exercise will help you refocus for your next study block on ECG interpretation.

title: Desk Stretches
description: Simple stretches to relieve neck, shoulder, and back tension from studying.

study_break_integration.optimal_timing: After completion of video or reading sessions
study_break_integration.purpose: Physical wellness maintenance during extended study

individual_personalization.for_kinesthetic_learners: Movement helps activate learning and memory processes
individual_personalization.for_long_session_preferences: Essential for students who prefer 45+ minute sessions
individual_personalization.for_physical_wellness_focus: Addresses most common study-related tension areas

ai_assistant_messaging: I notice you've been studying for 25 minutes. Let's do some quick stretches to keep your body comfortable for the next session!

title: Active Recall Check
description: Quick self-test on material just studied without looking at notes.

study_break_integration.optimal_timing: Immediately after completing a learning resource
study_break_integration.purpose: Reinforce learning before moving to next topic
study_break_integration.effectiveness: Improves retention by 50% compared to passive review

individual_personalization.for_achievement_focused: Provides immediate feedback on learning progress
individual_personalization.for_visual_learners: Can include drawing or visualizing concepts

ai_assistant_messaging: Great job completing that cardiac anatomy video! Let's quickly test what you learned before moving to ECG interpretation.
